title: Part B

The average number of people waiting in line during the first 4 hours is approximately

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for considering change in sign of L'

1 point is earned for the analysis

1 point is earned for the correct conclusion

L is differentiable [0, 9] so the Mean Value Theorem implies L'(t) > 0 for some t in (1, 3) and some t in (4, 7). Similarly, L'(t) < 0 for some t in (3, 4) and some t in (7, 8). Then, since L' is continuous on [0, 9], the Intermediate Value Theorem implies that L'(t) = 0 for at least three values of t in [0, 9].

OR

1 point is earned for considering relative extrema of L on (0, 9)

1 point is earned for the analysis

1 point is earned for the correct conclusion

The continuity of L on [1, 4] implies that L attains a maximum value there. Since L(3) > L(1) and L(3) > L(4), this maximum occurs on (1, 4). Similarly, L attains a minimum on (3, 7) and a maximum on (4, 8). L is differentiable, so L'(t) = 0 at each relative extreme point on (0, 9). Therefore L'(t) = 0 for at least three values of t in [0, 9].

[Note: There is a function L that satisfies the given conditions with L'(t) = 0 for exactly three values of t.]
